newsitem.title: NORWAY: FORECAST-Bergesen Q1 pre-tax seen at NOK 157 mln.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Bergesen Q1 pre-tax seen at NOK 157 mln.

text.p: Norway's largest shipping company Bergesen ASA is expected to book a profit before tax for the first quarter of 157 million crowns excluding gains or losses on foreign exchange, according to a Reuter poll of nine analysts.
Six of the analysts recommended buying the stock, two said hold and one made it a sell.

In general, the analysts with a buy recommendation saw improvement in the tanker market during the remainder of the year compared with today's level. One of those questioned expected modern vessels to command time-charter fees of $40 per day by the end of the year.
In the gas market, the analysts were moderately optimistic, particularly for the larger vessels. For smaller vessels the market was expected to be relatively flat for the rest of the year, they said.

"In the gas market I expect a slight up trend, but not the big change seen from last year to this year," said one analyst. "The market for the larger vessels will go up but that for the smaller ships will be about stable."
